Roger Fessenden yes Roger I have read it the part that stands out for me is  We place the cause of the Irish Republic under the protection of the most High God Whose blessing we invoke upon our arms and we pray that no one who serves that cause will dishonour it by cowardice inhumanity or rapine  so the IRA by starting its terrible murderous so called war has really dishonoured the very proclamation itself they were responsible for some of the most inhuman atrocities dividing the people apart and causing so much bitterness It has taken us years to get were we are today and still there is a deep division We cant turn the clock back unfortunately but we can as I say hope for a better future for everyone thats why I remember my childhood with happiness hatred gets you nowhere like it or not we have to live together and life is short to say the least youll realize that Roger when you get old God willing Look up Ruby Murray she came from the Donegal road in Belfast and she had lots of songs in the top 20 in the fifties just shows how popular she was with everyone when my mum and dads friends came round they took it in turns singing her songs everyone had a party piece like 40 shades of green beautiful song or a little piece of Heaven Galway Bay to name a few I wonder were we would have been today if all violence hadnt started but well never know our past could have been so different given a chance

Yes Hetty Davis you are absolutely right I am glad that you noted that The IRA in the later years did dishonor the cause and that is something that I think a lot of Republicans get mad at me for and I was recently called orange and other things for my apologizing for the actions of the IRA where I feel it is intact necissary for us to acknowledge that the IRA was wrong and apologize for it And hope they never resort to the same behavior If a Republican heard me say that they would say I was spitting in the face of the cause and I think that is extremely unfortunate that there are any Republicans that think that way I am very happy that you read it I think it is an absolutely beautiful document and if more people understood it like you did right away and took it to heart the world would be better off I believe as a Republican one needs to understand and respect the proclamation and if they did there wouldnt be acts of hate Anyway I hope you enjoyed reading I think it really is so beautiful Ahahaha life is definitely short Im already noticing it now I have no idea where my last 5 years went and Im only 20 now haha But yes I agree I tell people all the time that life is to short to be upset or angry all the time Choose to be happy and peaceful And thank you I will look them up perhaps I will recognize more of them I know Galway bay and Ive heard many references to 40 shades of green And yes again I agree with you we cant change the past all we can do is move on from here I actually have a tattoo on my chest that represents that concept Hetty as always its been wonderful

Roger Fessenden awk your only a young fella Roger whole life ahead of you God willingI dont know where the last 50 years have gone lol just you try to make good decisions in life for each 1 you make will have consequences I look back and think sometimes I would have done some things different lets say I wish I was your age and know what I know now dont let people get you down believe in what you know is right and good I hope some day you will come to NI your very welcome as they say if your Irish  in that good old song lol I hope Mr Trump isnt too hard on you all changing times for the American people and for the world but not always for the better but I live in hope Now you can say you have a Protestant Grandmother too Roger my daughters have a young American friend and he says Iam his Irish mum and I think thats a compliment dont be afraid to ask me anything you look after yourself and lets hope things work out here and our MLAs can come together God Bless you Roger and its been a pleasure to talk to a young Republican

If you care to read my original post I alluded to the fact that Ian paisley Snr stirred sectarian hatred and incited violence I did not imply that he was the operating commander of any terrorist group There is incontrovertible evidence of his toxic hate speech and actions as part of the various paramilitary organisations that he formed or was involved with These include the Ulster Protestant Action the Ulster Protestant Volunteers Third force and the Ulster Resistance Do you not know anything about Northern Irish history This is all well documented the speeches pictures and film footage is all available online I will give you a few examples to illustrate my point and you can decide if you still think that he was not responsible for inciting any violence or stirring sectarian tensions I do however suggest that you do a bit more thorough reading about this As part of the UPA he was responsible for naming the addresses of catholic businesses and homes during a rally These were later attacked and burnt out and taigs out painted on their walls He was also involved in campaigning for catholic families to be denied access to social housing He formed the UPV many of whose members were also in the UVF and who attended each others marches and rallies He publicly thanked the UVF for attending a march in 1966 shortly after which they launched an indiscrimate campaign of petrol bombing catholic homes and murdering innocent Catholics In 1968 he roused a rabble of 500 men with cudgels to counter a civil rights march in Armagh He was the main thrust of a workers strike which was aimed at paralysing the whole country for 2 weeks in 1974 in opposition to the sunningdale agreement The strikers targeted fellow protestants who refused to stop working and culminated in loyalists bombing in Dublin and Monaghan killing 33 innocent people He later organised another strike in 1977 boasting that he had personally taken part in the patrols during a speech in Westminster During this strike a loyalist bus driver was murdered for continuing to work and A UDR soldier was killed in a bomb targeted at a petrol station for staying open Need I go on there is a LOT more The point is it stinks of hypocrisy for the DUP to go on saying that we need to teach our children that terrorism was never justified when Paisley himself was responsible for inspiring some of that terrorism You keep going back to mentioning other groups who no doubt were at times equally or more responsible for the wrongs of the past They seem to be trying to move forward More than can be said for the DUP who Just want For me to vote Brexit perhaps the DUP could answer some fundamental questions regarding what foreign nationals are really bringing to our country 1 How many foreigner nationals are in our prison system and at what cost 2 How many hours of police time are taken up with arrests and court appearances of foreign nations and what is that costing our country 3 How much is the legal aid bill for court appearances solicitors and the interrupters which the EU says they are entitled to have 4 Why when a FN commits a crime no matter how big are small in this counrty are they not put on a plane cheaper alternative to putting them through our court system and sent back to their own country with an enforcement order that states they are not allowed back 5 How many babies have been born to foreign nations in Northern Ireland alone over the last 10 years putting strain on our already over stretched hospital services 6 How many diseases which were mainly erdicated in the UK have returned to our shores with the rise of immigration such as TB 7 How many foreign nationals are claiming family allowance for children not in this country 8 How many FN children are in our schools putting pressure on our once proud and strong education system 9How many foreign nations are on our hospital waiting lists 10 How many FN have registered with our doctors surgeries in the last 10 yrs meaning we now have longer waiting times 11 How much is the annual bill for interrupers for FN 12 How many foreign nationals are receiving DLA and support packages for disablities in NI 13 How many FN are claiming benefits as single parents and are getting the full range of benefits such as housing benefit and rates relief 14Because whole areas such as Dungannon have large numbers of FN where whole housing estates have been taken over by them how much less is a property now worth in these areas 15A Research and Information Service Paper for the Northern Ireland Assemble stated Almost 122000 long term international migrants are estimated to have arrived in Northern Ireland between 2000 and 2010 researchers now believe that in the last 6 years this figure has doubled putting huge econmic stress on our communities Why is this being allowed in a country of just over 2 million people I could go on but if you can answer these questions it may help to give a clearer indication of how much Free movement of people in the EU is really costing us and why we should vote out

Democratic Unionist Party The below is taken from the EIBs website Although they do lend outside the EU they are strongly weighted towards EU members and specifically state that lending is for investments which further EU policy The EIB is the European Unions bank We are the only bank owned by and representing the interests of the European Union Member States We work closely with other EU institutions to implement EU policy As the largest multilateral borrower and lender by volume we provide finance and expertise for sound and sustainable investment projects which contribute to furthering EU policy objectives More than 90 of our activity is focused on Europe but we also support the EUs external and development policies It seems strange to simultaneously favour EU exit whilst expressing a desire to avail of a service that exists chiefly to further said EU and its policies

Brexit The young the educated the Londoners the Scots the Welsh the Northern Irish the Irish Cypriots and Maltese must vote to remain If Britain chooses to withdraw from the European Union it will bring to an end a tempestuous relationship between the individualist leaning Brits and more Communatarian rest of the continent Within Britain it is clear that strong majorities exist for remaining in the EU in Scotland and in Northern Ireland and to a lesser extent in Wales Digging deeper London wishes strongly to remain and the rest of England slightly to strongly negative Poor little England What is astonishing is that in England those regions that are least affected by the migration which is portrayed as the catalyst of this crisis are the most vehement in their refusal to consider reasoned argument on the subject London a vibrant and international city full of migrants is the most positive part of England in favour of remaining in Europe Despite the 2011 census showing its ethnic makeup is less than 45 British which includes Wales Scotland and Northern Ireland far from feeling threatened by diversity the English capital clearly does not share UKIPs view that England would be better off out This most densely populated part of England does not feel there is a lack of space or jobs and does not see its culture threatened by migrants Comparing the capital to the rural counties from where distressing reports of the abuse of migrant workers emerge regularly we already have a feeling that the contradictory views and behaviour of the leaveshires lack morality whichever way we look at them The antics of Boris Johnson who has with great energy to give him his due taken over from the political fringe occupied by the failed UKIP party in flying the Leave flag and are an embarrasment The unavoidable comparisons with the other blonde moptop go deeper than dodgy hair styles While Trump is out to buy the US presidency with money and barely disguised gungho racism Johnson having lost his position as Mayor of London clearly sees an opportunity in the Leave campaign to challenge for ladership of the Tory party and a path to being Prime Minister That alone should be enough to ring alarm bells regarding his judgement of whats best for Britain The narrow education that is typical in English schools where the majority of young people do not learn a foreign language or economics or geography or history to the A levels creates a fertile ground for those who wish to spread untruth myths and outrageous lies about the European project It is imperfect So is the British take on democracy But it has delivered peace growth freedom of movement and human rights It is has had a mondernising and positive influence on every country it has touched Yes there are differences of approach and views and yes it sometimes takes years to arrive at less than perfect compromises But it does achiecve that where otherwise there would be nothing If the UK drops out of Europe where will the Foreign Direct Investment to Britain go We can expect a certain amount to go there regardless but a large part of that investment is prdicated on the UK providing access to the EU market with tarifs or trade barriers It is also predicated on the current situation where the pound does not swing wildly relative to the Euro Ireland and the Netherlands seem likely targets for companies As the OECD reports httpwwwoecdorgdafinvinvestmentpolicyFDIinFiguresApril2016pdf OECD FDI inflows almost doubled compared to 2014 most ly due to large inflows in Ireland the Netherlands  Switzerland and the United States  Investors from those countries were also responsible for the 35  increase in OECD outflows These countries appear among the top destinations and top sources of FDI worldwide in 2015 It cannot be a good thing for the UK to become less attractive as a destination for investment just as it chooses to go it alone And thats the nub of it If Britain votes to leave the EU they will be alone Remaining a member of NATO will not keep people in jobs or ensure British exports have free access to the single biggest market in the world Everyone whos opinion is based on science rather than emotion agrees from UK based business leaders politicans from all parties except UKIP and the DUP trade unions economic forecasters and academics The wider worlds most respected and influential economic organisations and leaders are of one voice  to leave would be anything from foolish to disastrous Even President Obama whos office would not usually pronounce on such sovereign discussions has made clear that this would damage the UKs position with the US In fact internationally the US mophead Trump appears to be Johnsons only ally there How long before he suggests that he will flood the Channel Tunnel and make the French pay for it Even the citizens of Europe are in every other EU country positive they want the UK to remain Johnsons charge that there is a democratic void in Europe is worth discussing but so to is the faulty democracry present in many EU states the UK included where winning as little as 38 of the vote can lead to overwhelming majorities in our nations parliaments That is a subject for another day For now let us hope that the young the educated the Londoners the Scots the Welsh the Northern Irish the Irish Cypriots and Maltese in Britain all come out in vast numbers because they are the ones who can ensure a positive result for Britain for Ireland and for Europe  a continent united If you know anyone with a vote  encourage them to vote to remain Anything else would be very bad for the UK TDH

1 The EU is not a sovereign entity It has only the powers that we give it 2 Westminster is the supreme law making authority in this country 3 In cases where EU law is given priority over domestic law in our courts it is only because the UK parliament has expressly instructed them to do so in our own legislation 4 Membership of the EU entails certain obligations but it also offers the opportunity to influence decision making on the world stage 5 The UK has enormous influence within the EU It is not something that happens TO us We are major players In practice nothing happens within the EU to which we are not party 6 We have two years to sever ties with the EU in the event of an exit win But future relations with the EU is a separate thing in terms of things like trade travel and legal agreements EU legal experts say typically it takes at least ten years just to get to a basic agreement 7 The Norwegian Model of EU market membership without EU membership is not necessarily available to us Even if it is it is very expensive We will have a huge number of rules to follow without any ability to influence what those rules are 8 It is completely beyond doubt that a vote to leave the EU we will terminate ALL trade agreements with countries outwith the EU as those were negotiated via the EU This will entail renegotiating around 70 trade agreements 9 Several countries have said they do not want to negotiate a new trade agreement with the UK until they know the terms of our new trade agreement with the EU The one that will take an estimated ten years This is the official public position of the USA and China
